input_text:
Job Title: Lead Project Engr

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges

Be the leader of a team assessing and driving achievement of program specific performance for multiple parallel projects, working closely with Project Engineers from other groups and the Program Managers. You will partner with the technical resource managers, assist with staffing, and be the primary focal for program cost, schedule, and technical issue coordination and escalation. You will lead prioritization of work packages, design goals and objectives, and drive overall program performance. The Platforms Center-of-Excellent Engineering team includes diverse Software, Electrical, Mechanical, and FPGA/ASIC teams and you will coordinate all of them with our customer programs.

Key Responsibilities

Project planning, status, execution, and escalationDrive clear communications between Technical leadersOptimize the team through procedural improvements and automationsDriving HW/SW quotation estimate efforts and approvalsFacilitating various teams to solutions and agreementDrive and improve project engineering practices for Hardware & Software groupsProcess champion: project-specific operating systems and larger reuse and multi-project considerationsMentoring junior engineers

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization

YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance or EngineeringMinimum of 5 years of relevant experienceDue to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization

WE VALUE

Business acumen – knowledge of current and emerging practices, methods, and information relating to discipline and application, within Aero and the larger industryDiverse teaming and collaboration/facilitation skillsChampion for continuous Project Engineering skill development and support staffing/trainingTrusted Advisor relationship with CustomersPersuade to influence others to accept new concepts, practices, deploy new approachesSignificant experience in engineering, especially familiarity with Platform Hardware/Software processes and practicesFamiliarity with Space and Defense project management and secure practicesGlobal workforce and virtual teaming expertise

Additional Information

JOB ID: HRD228715Category: EngineeringLocation: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United StatesExemptMust be a US Person or able to obtain export Authorization.

Global (ALL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
